s1: This course is based on the foundations set by the previous course on computer organisation.
s2: In this course, you will learn fundamental concepts of data communication and networking in addition to gaining a working knowledge of network scalability, mobility, security, and managing capabilities.

s1: It expands particularly into all forms of concurrent programming including aspects of massively parallel programming.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: This course introduces all basic mechanisms to analyse, design, and manage concurrent, single computer-node (multicore) as well as distributed applications (e.g. as performance or dependability enhancements).
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: Following on from the previous course, the fields of operating systems and networking will also be expanded on.
s2: In this course, you will learn fundamental concepts of data communication and networking in addition to gaining a working knowledge of network scalability, mobility, security, and managing capabilities.

s1: On the operating system side aspects of security, scheduling algorithms and memory management are discussed.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: More specific networking aspects follow on from message passing as a core concurrency construct.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: These include the basics of routing and dependable protocols.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: Model, design and program concurrent systems.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: Select appropriate modeling techniques, tools and mechanisms to solve a range of problems in concurrent and distributed systems.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.

s1: This includes the appropriate programming language and runtime environment for the task at hand.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.
Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: Understand the aspects of an operating system concerning scheduling, protection and memory management.
s2: Create a virtual machine and apply tools for packet analysis and file encryption in a lab environment.

s1: Employ message passing locally and over networks to construct distributed systems.
s2: Apply logical and physical networks at levels from the local area to the Internet.

s1: Distinguish as well as connect conceptual concurrency with physical parallelism at all levels of a distributed system.
s2: Apply logical and physical networks at levels from the local area to the Internet.

s1: Identify core aspects of operating systems and networks irrespective of the specific system at hand.
s2: Analyse the role of network standards, protocols, and layered models.
